content: sew this part to the body when you attach it do your best to line up the end of the head and the start of the back legs only stitches in the body/neck use your tapestry needle and the long tail from the head and sew together the front legs from the body and the stitches of the head see image when you are a few stitches away from done add some stuffing do not add too much the head should be squishy hide the tail in the body pokeball to dragonite reversible pattern by the nerd gremlin nose oval use yellow yarn round 1 chain 5 1 turning chain round 2 work on the top leg of the chain stitches 4 single_crochet 3 single_crochet in the last chain 3 single_crochet on the other side legs 2 single_crochet in the last chain 12 round 3 increase 3 single_crochet 3 increase 3 single_crochet 2 increase 17 round 4-5 17 single_crochet finish off and leave a long tail add stuffing use the long tail to sew it to the body and face with a tapestry needle put the bottom of the nose just at where the off white tummy part ends weave the long tail around the nose edge stitches and the posts of the pokemon body follow the shape of the nose piece and when you are a few stitches from done add a bit of stuffing again it should still be squishy see images pokeball to dragonite reversible pattern by the nerd gremlin image shows how i positioned the head on the body head point use yellow yarn round 1 6 single_crochet magic_ring with 6 single_crochet pokeball to dragonite reversible pattern by the nerd gremlin round 2 6 single_crochet finish off and leave a long tail to sew to the very top of the head centered with the head stitches horns use off-white yarn row 1 chain 10 turning chain row 2 working in the bottom bumps of the chains 10 slip_stitch finish off by pulling both the working yarn and the starting tail through the loop leave a long tail when you cut so you can sew the horns to the head sew to round 4 of the head on either side see image i pulled the start and end tails around a crochet post in the head and exited the two tails through the same hole somewhere else on the head then tied them together and then hid them in the head repeat for the other horn once you attach them to the head i shape them using a sewing needle and white thread i used this opportunity to further secure them to the head by also sewing the horn to the head with the sewing needle and thread then thread the needle up the horn stitches and sew the 3rd and 4th stitches together so the horn bends then doing the same in another 3 stitches but on the other side so it bends in the other
